author: HeinerTholen
body:
- The BTagCalibrationReader class is moved from CondFormats/BTauObjects to RecoBTag/PerformanceDB. The reason is that it is not stored into the database and maintenance needs only to be signed off by the btag conveners.
- The current implementation of BTagCalibrationReader assumes that there is only one measurementType for all jet-flavors, where, in the 50ns scale factors, we have "mujets" for B- and C-flavor and "comb" for UDSG. => Interface change.
- In the analysis one needs to know min- and max-pt for a given jet-flavor, eta and discr value, in order to handle the uncertainty if it's out of bounds. A function for returning the pt-bounds is added, so that the user does not need to hardcode values for that.
title: BTagCalibrationReader: move to RecoBTag/PerformanceDB, interface updates.
